subject: Re: [junit] [OT] coverage plugins for eclipse?
msgSnippet: ... The only other option I know is Cobertura. There s no official plugin, but the build file can make one. Whether it works or not, I don t know. It could
messageBody:
Thomas L Roche wrote:

> I'm wondering, what are folks who use Eclipse (or Eclipse-based
> products) using to do coverage measurement and reporting? One option
> is to just run the coverage tool from the command line or ant, but I'd
> really like something more integrated, e.g.


The only other option I know is Cobertura. There's no official plugin,
but the build file can make one. Whether it works or not, I don't know.
It could probably be made to work with a little hacking.

http://cobertura.sourceforge.net/

--
